snippet: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev told the F.B.I. that he and his brother finished building their bombs sooner than expected and that they considered suicide attacks, according to two officials.
abstract: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev tells Federal Bureau of Investigation interrogators that he and his brother Tamerlan first considered suicide attacks, striking on the Fourth of July, but decided to attack on April 15 at Boston Marathon after building bombs faster than expected; details emerge as FBI moves forward with trying to determine how the brothers were radicalized.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT, MARK MAZZETTI, MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and SCOTT SHANE
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by William K. Rashbaum and Serge F. Kovaleski from New York, and Emmarie Huetteman from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev told the F.B.I. that he and his brother finished building their bombs sooner than expected and that they considered suicide attacks, according to two officials.

headline.seo: Boston Plot Said to Initially Target July 4
headline.main: Boston Plotters Said to Initially Target July 4 for Attack
headline.print_headline: Boston Plot Said To Have Focused On July 4 Attack
headline.sub: Surviving Brother Says Suicide Attacks Were Considered
